DOC.brief_summary: Malnutrition is a frequent complication in patients with liver cirrhosis. Most patients have decreased dietary intake due to ascites, hepatic encephalopathy and pro-inflammatory cytokines. We hypothesized that branched chain aminoacids can improve nutritional status and delay episodes of hepatic encephalopathy
DOC.brief_title: Branched Chain Aminoacid Supplementation in Patients With Liver Cirrhosis
DOC.criteria: Ambulatory patients Patients with confirmed diagnose of liver cirrhosis Patients classified as ChildPugh A or Child Pugh B Acute or chronic renal failure Pregnancy Overt hepatic encephalopathy
